intro: Aframomum lutarium, commonly known as the African grain of paradise, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the ginger family, Zingiberaceae, and is characterized by its aromatic, tubular flowers. The plant produces small, yellowish-orange fruits that contain numerous seeds. Its rhizomes are often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. The botanical features of Aframomum lutarium make it an important species in both ecological and medicinal contexts.
